full_content:
The code provided defines a JavaScript class called `DistanceMeter` that calculates and displays the distance traveled by an object in a game. It takes a canvas element, a sprite position, and a canvas width as parameters in its constructor.

The class has several properties and methods related to distance calculation, flash effects, sound effects, and high score display. Some of the notable methods include:

* `init(width)`: This method initializes the distance meter with the given width parameter. It calculates the maximum distance units based on the configuration object and sets up the canvas context and sprite position.
* `drawHighScore()`: This method draws the high score text on the canvas using the saved canvas context and global alpha property.
* `setHighScore(distance)`: This method sets the high score with the given distance parameter and converts it to a string in the format "HI [score]".
* `hasClickedOnHighScore(e)`: This method checks if the mouse event e intersects with the high score text area. It returns true if there is an intersection and false otherwise.
* `getHighScoreBounds()`: This method returns the bounds of the high score text area on the canvas.
* `flashHighScore()`: This method flashes the high score text area using a timer and requestAnimationFrame function. It stops flashing after a certain number of iter
